title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-1#char=0,206
text: In 1865, Wilhelm Röntgen tried to attend the University of Utrecht without having the necessary credentials required for a regular student. In 1901 Röntgen was awarded the very first Nobel Prize in Physics.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-10#char=0,235
text: Giulio Natta was born in Imperia, Italy. He earned his degree in chemical engineering from the Politecnico di Milano university in Milan in 1924. Natta won a Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1963 with Karl Ziegler for work on high polymers.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-100#char=0,278
text: Pauli spent a year at the University of Göttingen as the assistant to Max Born, and the following year at the Institute for Theoretical Physics in Copenhagen, which later became the Niels Bohr Institute in 1965. From 1923 to 1928, he was a lecturer at the University of Hamburg.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-101#char=0,142
text: In 1991 Linda Buck became an assistant professor of neurobiology at Harvard University where she expanded her knowledge of the nervous system.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-11#char=0,139
text: From 1936 to 1938 he moved as a full professor and director of the Institute of Industrial Chemistry at the Polytechnic Institute of Turin.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-12#char=0,152
text: Goeppert Mayer married Joseph Edward Mayer, and moved to the United States, where Goeppert Mayer was an associate professor at Johns Hopkins University.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-13#char=0,216
text: Strict rules against nepotism prevented Johns Hopkins University from taking Goeppert Mayer on as a faculty member, but she was given a job as an assistant and published a landmark paper on double beta decay in 1935.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-14#char=0,169
text: After the war, the woman became a voluntary associate professor of Physics at the University of Chicago and a senior physicist at the nearby Argonne National Laboratory.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-15#char=0,116
text: The woman was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1963, which she shared with J. Hans D. Jensen and Eugene Wigner.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-16#char=0,245
text: In December 1941, Goeppert Mayer took up her first paid professional position, teaching science part-time at Sarah Lawrence College and in 1960, Maria Goeppert was appointed full professor of physics at the University of California at San Diego.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-17#char=0,127
text: The poet was born in Paris as the only child of Jean-Baptiste Sartre, an officer of the French Navy, and Anne-Marie Schweitzer.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-18#char=0,258
text: Martin Luther King then began doctoral studies in systematic theology at Boston University and received his Ph.D. degree on June 5, 1955, with a dissertation on "A Comparison of the Conceptions of God in the Thinking of Paul Tillich and Henry Nelson Wieman".

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-19#char=0,206
text: As a Christian minister, the activist's main influence was Jesus Christ and the Christian gospels, which he would almost always quote in his religious meetings, speeches at church, and in public discourses.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-2#char=0,253
text: After graduating from Magdalene College in 1921, Blackett spent ten years working at the Cavendish Laboratory as an experimental physicist with Professor Rutherford and in 1923 became a fellow of King's College, Cambridge, a position he held until 1933.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-20#char=0,258
text: Beckett studied French, Italian, and English at Trinity College, Dublin from 1923 to 1927. Beckett graduated with a BA and, after teaching briefly at Campbell College in Belfast, took up the post of lecteur d'anglais in the École Normale Supérieure in Paris.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-21#char=0,51
text: One of the them was an eminent scholar at Berkeley.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-22#char=0,119
text: In 1930, Beckett returned to Trinity College as a lecturer, but he resigned in 1931 collecting a brief academic career.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-23#char=0,125
text: The novelist spent some time in London, where in 1931 he published Proust, his critical study of French author Marcel Proust.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-24#char=0,111
text: Neruda derived his pen name from the Czech poet Jan Neruda and became known as a poet when he was 10 years old.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-25#char=0,402
text: During his lifetime, Neruda occupied many diplomatic positions and served a term as a Senator for the Chilean Communist Party. When President González Videla outlawed communism in Chile in 1948, a warrant was issued for Neruda's arrest. Friends hide him for months in the basement of a house in the port city of Valparaíso. Later, Neruda escaped through a mountain pass near Maihue Lake into Argentina.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-26#char=0,208
text: Quasimodo was born in Modica, Sicily to Gaetano Quasimodo and Clotilde Ragusa. In 1908 his family moved to Messina, as his father had been sent there to help the population struck by a devastating earthquake.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-27#char=0,160
text: In June 1968, when Quasimodo was in Amalfi for a discourse and he was struck by a cerebral hemorrhage. The poet died a few days later in the hospital in Naples.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-28#char=0,199
text: Thomas Eliot was invited to study at the Institute for Advanced Study by Director Frank Aydelotte. Eliot was born into the Eliot family, a Boston Brahmin family with roots in England and New England.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-29#char=0,100
text: Eliot attended Milton Academy in Massachusetts for a preparatory year, where he met Scofield Thayer.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-3#char=0,254
text: The man served on various committees and spent time at the Royal Aircraft Establishment in Farnborough, where he made a major contribution to the design of the Mark XIV bomb sight which allowed bombs to be released without a level bombing run beforehand.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-30#char=0,222
text: After working as a assistant at Harvard from 1909 to 1910, Eliot moved to Paris, where from 1910 to 1911, he studied philosophy at the Sorbonne. Eliot attended lectures by Henri Bergson and read poetry with Alain-Fournier.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-31#char=0,184
text: Throughout this time this person also worked with Marguerite Vogt. In 1962, Renato Dulbecco moved to the Salk Institute and then in 1972 to The Imperial Cancer Research Fund in London.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-32#char=0,207
text: Dulbecco was born in Catanzaro (Southern Italy), but spent his childhood and grew up in Liguria, in the coastal city Imperia. Dulbecco graduated from high school at 16, then moved to the University of Turin.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-33#char=0,218
text: Prelog attended elementary school in Sarajevo, but in 1915, moved to Zagreb where he graduated from elementary school. At first, Prelog attended gymnasium in Zagreb, but soon afterwards, his father got a job in Osijek.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-34#char=0,189
text: After World War II broke out, in 1941 Prelog was invited in Germany by Richard Kuhn as lecturer, and shortly afterwards, Lavoslav Ružička, invited Prelog to visit him on his way to Germany.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-35#char=0,267
text: Nicolaas Bloembergen received his Ph.D. degree from University of Leiden under Cor Gorter in 1948; while pursuing his PhD at Harvard, Nicolaas Bloembergen also worked part-time as a graduate research assistant for Edward Mills Purcell at the MIT Radiation Laboratory.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-36#char=0,225
text: In 1950 James Tobin moved to Yale University, where he remained for the rest of his career. James Tobin joined the Cowles Foundation, which moved to Yale in 1955, also serving as its president between 1955–1961 and 1964-1965.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-37#char=0,106
text: James Tobin married Elizabeth Fay Ringo, a former M.I.T. student of Paul Samuelson, on September 14, 1946.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-38#char=0,192
text: William Golding was born in Newquay, Cornwall where he spent many childhood holidays. He grew up in Marlborough, Wiltshire, where his father was a science master at Marlborough Grammar School.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-39#char=0,80
text: William Golding was appointed Knight Bachelor by the Queen Elizabeth II in 1988.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-4#char=0,306
text: Hans Geiger had been appointed director of the new Laboratory for Radioactivity there in 1912. At the PTR, Bothe was an assistant to Geiger from 1913 to 1920, a scientific member of Geiger's staff from 1920 to 1927, and from 1927 to 1930 he succeeded Geiger as director of the Laboratory for Radioactivity.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-40#char=0,331
text: Carlo Rubbia studied physics at the University of Pisa and Scuola Normale in Pisa. Rubbia graduated on cosmic ray experiments in 1957 with Marcello Conversi. Rubbia then went to the United States, where he spent about one and a half years at Columbia University performing experiments on the decay and the nuclear capture of muons.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-41#char=0,117
text: On 30 August 2013, Rubbia was appointed to the Senate of Italy as a Senator for Life by President Giorgio Napolitano.

labels.name: Senate of the Republic of Italy

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-42#char=0,210
text: Rita Levi-Montalcini had been the oldest living Nobel laureate and was the first ever to reach a 100th birthday. On 22 April 2009, Rita Levi-Montalcini was feted with a 100th birthday party at Rome's city hall.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-43#char=0,191
text: Born on 22 April 1909 at Turin Rita Levi-Montalcini were the youngest of four children. Her parents were Adele Montalcini, a painter, and Adamo Levi, an electrical engineer and mathematician.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-44#char=0,131
text: After graduating in 1936, she went to work as Giuseppe Levi's assistant, but her academic career was cut short by Benito Mussolini.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-45#char=0,137
text: Levi-Montalcini lost her assistant position in the anatomy department after a 1938 law barring Jews from university positions was passed.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-46#char=0,322
text: In September 1946, Levi-Montalcini accepted an invitation to Washington University in St. Louis, under the supervision of Professor Viktor Hamburger. Although the initial invitation was for one semester, after she repeated the exciting results from her home laboratory, Hamburger offered her a research associate position.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-47#char=0,85
text: She was appointed as Senator for Life in Italy by the President Carlo Azeglio Ciampi.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-48#char=0,141
text: Elie Wiesel was born in Sighet, Transylvania, Maramureș, Romania, in the Carpathian Mountains. His parents were Sarah Feig and Shlomo Wiesel.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-49#char=0,262
text: In 1940, Romania lost the town of Sighet to Hungary following the Second Vienna Award. In 1944, Wiesel, his family, and the rest of the town were placed in one of the two ghettos in Sighet. Wiesel and his family lived in the larger of the two, on Serpent Street.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-5#char=0,218
text: After the armistice between France and Germany in the summer of 1940, Walter Bothe received orders to inspect the cyclotron Frédéric Joliot-Curie had built in Paris. While it had been built, it was not yet operational.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-50#char=0,91
text: Wiesel taught Hebrew and worked as a choirmaster before becoming a professional journalist.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-51#char=0,184
text: During the early 2007 selection process for the Kadima candidate for President, Prime Minister Ehud Olmert reportedly offered Wiesel the nomination, but Wiesel was not very interested.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-52#char=0,155
text: In 2009, Wiesel criticized the Vatican for lifting the excommunication of controversial bishop Richard Williamson, a member of the Society of Saint Pius X.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-53#char=0,80
text: Tonegawa was born in Nagoya, Japan and attended the Hibiya High School in Tokyo.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-54#char=0,119
text: Mandela served 27 years in prison, initially on Robben Island, and later in Pollsmoor Prison and Victor Verster Prison.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-55#char=0,113
text: The girl was born on 18 July 1918 in the village of Mvezo in Umtata, then a part of South Africa's Cape Province.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-56#char=0,132
text: John started with high expectations and enthusiasm to study chemistry at the famous Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Zurich.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-57#char=0,75
text: A french was born in Paris, France, and was home-schooled to the age of 12.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-58#char=0,215
text: In 1971, he became professor at the Collège de France. He was then director of the École Supérieure de Physique et de Chimie Industrielles de la Ville de Paris, a post he held from 1976 until his retirement in 2002.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-59#char=0,148
text: Hulse was born in New York City and attended Bronx High School of Science and the Cooper Union before moving to University of Massachusetts Amherst.

labels.name: The Bronx High School of Science

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-6#char=0,191
text: Lutuli accepted the post of principal and only teacher at a primary school in rural Blaauwbosch, Newcastle, Natal. Here Lutuli was confirmed in the Methodist Church and became a lay preacher.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-60#char=0,193
text: Michael Smith first attended St. Nicholas Church of England School, a state-run elementary school. At the time, few children from state schools in England went on to further academic education.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-61#char=0,214
text: Michael was born April 26, 1932, in Blackpool, Lancashire, England. He immigrated to Canada in 1956 and became a Canadian citizen in 1963. Michael married Helen Wood Christie on August 6, 1960, on Vancouver Island.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-62#char=0,223
text: Mario Capecchi was born in the city of Verona as the only child of Luciano Capecchi, an airman, and Lucy Ramberg, an American-born daughter of Impressionist painter Lucy Dodd Ramberg and German archaeologist Walter Ramberg.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-63#char=0,93
text: In 1946 a woman from Ghana working at RCA sent a friend money to return to the United States.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-64#char=0,157
text: Mario Capecchi was a Fellow of the Society of Fellows at Harvard University from 1967 to 1969. In 1973 Capecchi joined the faculty at the University of Utah.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-65#char=0,225
text: Fo was born at Leggiuno Sangiano, in Lombardy's Province of Varese, near the eastern shore of Lago Maggiore. His younger brother Fulvio would become a theatre administrator, their younger sister Bianca Fo Garambois, a writer.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-66#char=0,142
text: In 1940, Dario Fo moved to Milan to study at the Brera Academy, however he joined the fascist army of Mussolini's Repubblica Sociale Italiana.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-67#char=0,132
text: After the war Frank returned to the University of Bologna, also taking up architectural studies at the local faculty of engineering.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-68#char=0,114
text: Appointed Professor at the University of Rome, man's seminars there included Harlequin and the commedia dell'arte.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-69#char=0,189
text: Kroto was educated at Bolton School and went to Sheffield University in 1958. At Sheffield, Kroto obtained a first class honours BSc degree in Chemistry and a PhD in Molecular Spectroscopy.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-7#char=0,207
text: In 1944 Lutuli joined the African National Congress. In 1945 he was elected to the Committee of the KwaZulu Provincial Division of the African National Congress and in 1951 to the presidency of the Division.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-70#char=0,67
text: A man became a researcher at Harvard University in Applied Physics.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-71#char=0,118
text: Tonegawa received his doctorate from the University of California in San Diego where he worked with Dr Masaki Hayashi.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-72#char=0,258
text: A man from Japan received his bachelor's degree from Kyoto University in 1963. Such a man did post-doctoral work at the Salk Institute in San Diego in the laboratory of Renato Dulbecco, then worked at the Basel Institute for Immunology in Basel, Switzerland.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-73#char=0,317
text: An international lobbied for his release, which was granted in 1990 amid escalating civil strife. Mandela joined negotiations with Nationalist President F. W. de Klerk to abolish apartheid and establish multiracial elections in 1994, in which he led the ANC to victory and became South Africa's first black president.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-74#char=0,155
text: In 1969 Mario became an Assistant Professor in the Department of Biochemistry at Harvard Medical School. Mario was promoted to Associate Professor in 1971.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-75#char=0,242
text: Albert Modiano (1912–77, born in Paris), was of Italian Jewish origin; on his paternal side he was descended from a Sephardic family of Thessaloniki, Greece. His mother, Louisa Colpijn (1918-2015), was an actress also known as Louisa Colpeyn.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-76#char=0,251
text: Shuji Nakamura graduated from the University of Tokushima in 1977 with a B.Eng. degree in electronic engineering, and obtained an M.Eng. degree in the same subject two years later, after which he joined the Nichia Corporation, also based in Tokushima.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-77#char=0,215
text: He was a boy scout, with the Boy Scouts of America and became an Eagle Scout. He attended Washington University in St. Louis for undergraduate studies as an Alexander S. Langsdorf Fellow, and obtained three degrees.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-78#char=0,176
text: Munro began writing as a teenager, publishing her first story, "The Dimensions of a Shadow", in 1950 while studying English and journalism at the University of Western Ontario.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-79#char=0,226
text: Between 1987 and 1989, Yamanaka was a resident in orthopedic surgery at the National Osaka Hospital. His first operation was to remove a benign tumor from his friend Shuichi Hirata, a task he could not complete after one hour.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-8#char=0,152
text: Nelson Mandela publicly launched Umkhonto we Sizwe at the All In Conference, where delegates from several movements had convened to discuss cooperation.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-80#char=0,229
text: She married James Sirleaf when she was 17 years old, and then traveled with him to the United States in 1961 to continue her studies and earned an associate degree in accounting at Madison Business College, in Madison, Wisconsin.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-81#char=0,188
text: From 1963 until 1965, Akira Suzuki worked as a postdoctoral student with Herbert Charles Brown at Purdue University and after returning to the University of Hokkaidō he became a professor.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-82#char=0,169
text: In 2001 he became a professor of physics at the University of Manchester, and was appointed director of the Manchester Centre for Mesoscience and Nanotechnology in 2002.

labels.name: Manchester Centre for Mesoscience and Nanotechnology

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-83#char=0,288
text: In recent years Elizabeth Blackburn and her colleagues have been investigating the effect of stress on telomerase and telomeres with particular emphasis on mindfulness meditation. She appeared in the 1995 science documentary Death by Design/The Life and Times of Life and Times in the US.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-84#char=0,126
text: She received her PhD in 1975 and interned at the U.S. National Institutes of Health before returning to the Pasteur Institute.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-85#char=0,174
text: In 1952, Martti Ahtisaari moved to Oulu with his family to seek employment. Then he continued his education in high school, graduating in 1952. He also joined the local YMCA.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-86#char=0,313
text: In 1982, Lessing tried to publish two novels under a pseudonym, Jane Somers, to show the difficulty new authors faced in trying to have their works in print. The novels were declined by Lessing's UK publisher, but were later accepted by another English publisher, Michael Joseph, and in the US by Alfred A. Knopf.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-87#char=0,233
text: Fert graduated in 1962 from the École Normale Supérieure in Paris. He received his Ph.D. (doctorat de troisième cycle) in 1963 and his Sc.D. (doctorat des sciences), both from the Orsay Faculty of Sciences of the University of Paris.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-88#char=0,187
text: Ciechanover is a member of the Israel Academy of Sciences and Humanities, the Pontifical Academy of Sciences, and is a foreign associate of the United States National Academy of Sciences.

labels.name: Israel Academy of Sciences and Humanities

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-89#char=0,254
text: In 1973, David Gross, working with his first graduate student, Frank Wilczek, at Princeton University, discovered asymptotic freedom, which holds that the closer quarks are to each other, the less the strong interaction (or color charge) is between them.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-9#char=0,121
text: In 1966, Albert Lutuli was visited by United States Senator Robert F. Kennedy, who was visiting South Africa at the time.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-90#char=0,152
text: During World War II, Imre was deported at the age of 14 with other Hungarian Jews to the Auschwitz concentration camp, and was later sent to Buchenwald.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-91#char=0,134
text: Zewail has been nominated and will participate in President Barack Obama's Presidential Council of Advisors on Science and Technology.

labels.name: United States President's Council of Advisors on Science and Technology

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-92#char=0,186
text: In 1953, he moved to Trinity College, Cambridge, where he earned a second B.A. in Economics in 1955 with a first class topping the list. He was elected President of the Cambridge Majlis.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-93#char=0,160
text: In 1949 Toni Morrison went to Howard University graduating in 1953 with a B.A. in English; she went on to earn a Master of Arts from Cornell University in 1955.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-94#char=0,131
text: After receiving his PhD, Mullis left science to write fiction, but quit and became a biochemist at a medical school in Kansas City.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-95#char=0,149
text: Neher and Sakmann were the first to record the currents of single ion channels on a live cell through their development of the patch-clamp technique.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-96#char=0,151
text: Gordimer studied for a year at the University of the Witwatersrand, where she mixed for the first time with fellow professionals across the colour bar.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-97#char=0,227
text: Zsigmondy was born in Vienna, Austrian Empire, to Hungarian parents Irma Szakmáry, a poet born in Martonvásár, and Adolf Zsigmondy Sr., a scientist from Bratislava who invented several surgical instruments for use in dentistry.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-98#char=0,198
text: Zsigmondy left Schott Glass in 1900, but remained in Jena as private lecturer to conduct his research. Together with the optical instrument manufacturer Zeiss, he developed the slit ultramicroscope.

title: http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/data/oke-challenge/task-1/sentence-99#char=0,170
text: Pauli was born in Vienna to a chemist Wolfgang Joseph Pauli and his wife Bertha Camilla Schütz. His middle name was given in honor of his godfather, physicist Ernst Mach.
